result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracy R Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and DNA to be paid on a payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing 5/01/2016; alternate 9 days jail.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tracy R Ashford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tracy R Ashford in court with attorney Eryn Menden for  Samuel W. Benedict.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

Jail:  18 days, with 14 days credit for a time served disposition
Court costs: $243.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 05/01/2015 or alternate of 9 days jail
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Tracy R Ashford in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting trial date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tracy R Ashford in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to further review this matter with his client as to any special pleas being entered. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Samuel W. Benedict in court.   Defendant Tracy R Ashford did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as the defendant is in custody in Milwaukee County were she is serving committment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save store. Defendant not to commit any new crimes.

Defendant Tracy R Ashford in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the bail motion filed by Attorney Benedict.    Attorney Benedict requests that Court amend the bond to a signature bond. The State objects to any bail modification. The Court grants the request for bail modification.  The Court modifies the bail to a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 with the following conditions: Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save store. Defendant not to commit any new crimes.
Motion for bail reduction or modification
Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save store

Defendant Tracy R Ashford in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defendant allowed a non collect call.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
